questions.question: The biggest challenge in video generation compared to images is:
options: Temporal consistency — maintaining coherence across frames
questions.explanation: Each frame must be visually consistent with adjacent frames. Objects flickering, morphing, or disappearing between frames breaks the illusion.

questions.question: Image-to-video models take a static image and animate it into a video sequence.
questions.explanation: Image-to-video models use a reference image as the starting frame and generate subsequent frames that maintain the visual style and content.

questions.question: Video upscaling helps with:
options: Increasing resolution and detail of generated video
questions.explanation: Generation often happens at lower resolution for speed. Upscaling models then enhance the output to higher resolution with added detail.
